results.title: High-dose simvastatin for aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage: multicenter randomized controlled double-blinded clinical trial.
results.text_hl: We hypothesized that a high dose of 80 mg of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ daily for 3 weeks would reduce the incidence of delayed @<m>DISEASE_Attention_Deficit_Disorder_with_Hyperactivity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001289 @@@ischemic deficits@@@ after @DISEASE_Subarachnoid_Hemorrhage @DISEASE_MESH:D013345 @@@subarachnoid hemorrhage@@@ compared with a lower dose (40 mg of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ daily) and lead to improved clinical outcomes.

citations.NLM: Wong GK, Chan DY, Siu DY, Zee BC, Poon WS, Chan MT, Gin T, Leung M, HDS-SAH Investigators. High-dose simvastatin for aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage: multicenter randomized controlled double-blinded clinical trial. Stroke. 2015 Feb;46(2):382-8. PMID: 25516195
citations.BibTeX: @article{25516195, title={High-dose simvastatin for aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage: multicenter randomized controlled double-blinded clinical trial.}, author={Wong GK and Chan DY and Siu DY and Zee BC and Poon WS and Chan MT and Gin T and Leung M and HDS-SAH Investigators}, journal={Stroke}, volume={46}, number={2}, pages={382-8}}

results.title: High-dose simvastatin for aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage: a multicenter, randomized, controlled, double-blind clinical trial protocol.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: To determine whether 80 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ daily (high dose) over 3 weeks initiated within 96 hours of the ictus will reduce the incidence of delayed @<m>DISEASE_Attention_Deficit_Disorder_with_Hyperactivity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001289 @@@ischemic deficits@@@ after @DISEASE_Subarachnoid_Hemorrhage @DISEASE_MESH:D013345 @@@subarachnoid hemorrhage@@@ compared with 40 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ daily (normal dose), leading to improvements in clinical outcomes and thus cost-effectiveness.

citations.NLM: Wong GK, Liang M, Tan H, Lee MW, Po YC, Chan KY, Poon WS. High-dose simvastatin for aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage: a multicenter, randomized, controlled, double-blind clinical trial protocol. Neurosurgery. 2013 May;72(5):840-4. PMID: 23392270
citations.BibTeX: @article{23392270, title={High-dose simvastatin for aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage: a multicenter, randomized, controlled, double-blind clinical trial protocol.}, author={Wong GK and Liang M and Tan H and Lee MW and Po YC and Chan KY and Poon WS}, journal={Neurosurgery}, volume={72}, number={5}, pages={840-4}}

results.title: Simvastatin reduces vasospasm after aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage: results of a pilot randomized clinical trial.
results.text_hl: Highest mean middle cerebral artery transcranial Doppler velocities were significantly lower in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@-treated group (103+/-41 versus 149+/-47; P<0.01).

citations.NLM: Lynch JR, Wang H, McGirt MJ, Floyd J, Friedman AH, Coon AL, Blessing R, Alexander MJ, Graffagnino C, Warner DS, Laskowitz DT. Simvastatin reduces vasospasm after aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage: results of a pilot randomized clinical trial. Stroke. 2005 Sep;36(9):2024-6. PMID: 16051891
citations.BibTeX: @article{16051891, title={Simvastatin reduces vasospasm after aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage: results of a pilot randomized clinical trial.}, author={Lynch JR and Wang H and McGirt MJ and Floyd J and Friedman AH and Coon AL and Blessing R and Alexander MJ and Graffagnino C and Warner DS and Laskowitz DT}, journal={Stroke}, volume={36}, number={9}, pages={2024-6}}

results.title: Simvastatin inhibits the apoptosis of hippocampal cells in a mouse model of Alzheimer's disease
results.text_hl: Furthermore, treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ improved the @DISEASE_Dementia @DISEASE_MESH:D003704 @@@dementia@@@ status of 3xTg-@DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@AD@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@, as determined by a learning task in which @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ exhibited significantly reduced @<m>DISEASE_Attention_Deficit_Disorder_with_Hyperactivity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001289 @@@attention impairment@@@, @DISEASE_Disruptive_Impulse_Control_and_Conduct_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D007174 @@@impulsivity@@@ and compulsivity (P<0.01).

citations.NLM: Hu X, Song C, Fang M, Li C. Simvastatin inhibits the apoptosis of hippocampal cells in a mouse model of Alzheimer's disease Exp Ther Med. 2018 Feb;15(2):1795-1802. PMID: 29434767
citations.BibTeX: @article{29434767, title={Simvastatin inhibits the apoptosis of hippocampal cells in a mouse model of Alzheimer's disease}, author={Hu X and Song C and Fang M and Li C}, journal={Exp Ther Med}, volume={15}, number={2}, pages={1795-1802}}

results.title: Simvastatin for cognitive deficits and behavioural problems in patients with neurofibromatosis type 1 (NF1-SIMCODA): a randomised, placebo-controlled trial.
results.text_hl: We did not assess outcomes in two @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ in the placebo group because they needed additional drug therapy. @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ for 12 months had no effect on full-scale intelligence (treatment effect compared with placebo -1 3 IQ points [95% CI -3 8 to 1 3]; p=0 33), @<m>DISEASE_Attention_Deficit_Disorder_with_Hyperactivity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001289 @@@attention problems@@@ (-1 6 T-score points [-4 3 to 1 0]; p=0 23), and internalising @DISEASE_Alcohol_Related_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D019973 @@@behavioural problems@@@ (-0 1 T-score points [-3 3 to 3 1]; p=0 96). 38 (88%) of 43 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ on @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and 39 (95%) of 41 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ on placebo reported adverse events, which were serious in two and four @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, respectively.

citations.NLM: van der Vaart T, Plasschaert E, Rietman AB, Renard M, Oostenbrink R, Vogels A, de Wit MC, Descheemaeker MJ, Vergouwe Y, Catsman-Berrevoets CE, Legius E, Elgersma Y, Moll HA. Simvastatin for cognitive deficits and behavioural problems in patients with neurofibromatosis type 1 (NF1-SIMCODA): a randomised, placebo-controlled trial. Lancet Neurol. 2013 Nov;12(11):1076-83. PMID: 24090588
